body:
# selenium.cr

Selenium client for interacting with web pages for browser automation.

[API Documentation](https://matthewmcgarvey.github.io/selenium.cr/)

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     selenium:
       github: matthewmcgarvey/selenium.cr
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "selenium"
```

### Creating a Driver

```crystal
driver = Selenium::Driver.for(:chrome, base_url: "http://localhost:9515")
```

Available drivers:

- :chrome (using chromedriver)
- :firefox (using geckodriver)
- :remote (general purpose)

### Running with a service

Rather than running chromedriver yourself, you can give the driver a service which will run the process for you.

```crystal
driver = Selenium::Driver.for(:chrome, service: Service.chrome(driver_path: "~/.webdrivers/chromedriver"))
```

You must call `driver.stop` when you are finished or it will leave the service running.
Consider using [webdrivers.cr](https://github.com/matthewmcgarvey/webdrivers.cr) for automatically installing drivers and managing the driver path for you.

### Creating a Session

```crystal
capabilities = Selenium::Chrome::Capabilities.new
capabilities.args(["no-sandbox", "headless", "disable-gpu"])
driver.create_session(capabilities)
```

Use the appropriate `Capabilities` class for whichever browser you choose.

## Development

Run `crystal spec` to run the tests. It will run the tests in headless mode.

To run the tests with chrome headlessly:

```crystal
SELENIUM_BROWSER=chrome crystal spec --tag "~chrome"
```

To run the tests with firefox headlessly:

```crystal
SELENIUM_BROWSER=firefox crystal spec --tag "~firefox"

```

The tag skips any specs that are know to break with those browsers.
Running just `crystal spec` will use chrome.

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/matthewmcgarvey/selenium.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Matthew McGarvey](https://github.com/matthewmcgarvey) - creator and maintainer

types.name: Action
types.doc:
I want to have seperate actions for each type (pause, pointer, key)
but when I did that, I wasn't able to get the type union or inheritance working for some reason
types.summary: I want to have seperate actions for each type (pause, pointer, key) but when I did that, I wasn't able to get the type union or inheritance working for some reason

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (type, duration = nil, value : Char? = nil, button = nil, origin = nil, x = nil, y = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(type, duration, value, button, origin, x, y)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: execute
instance_methods.args_string: (command, path_variables : Hash(String, String) = {} of String => String, parameters = {} of String => String) : JSON::Any

def.name: execute
def.body:
method, path = DEFAULT_COMMANDS[command]
full_path = path_variables.reduce(path) do |acc, entry|
  acc.sub(entry.first, entry.last)
end
execute(method, full_path, parameters.to_json)

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (name, value, path = nil, domain = nil, secure = nil, http_only = nil, expiry = nil, same_site = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(name, value, path, domain, secure, http_only, expiry, same_site)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

constants.name: DEFAULT_COMMANDS
constants.value: {new_session: {:post, "/session"}, delete_session: {:delete, "/session/:session_id"}, status: {:get, "/status"}, get_timeouts: {:get, "/session/:session_id/timeouts"}, set_timeouts: {:post, "/session/:session_id/timeouts"}, navigate_to: {:post, "/session/:session_id/url"}, get_current_url: {:get, "/session/:session_id/url"}, back: {:post, "/session/:session_id/back"}, forward: {:post, "/session/:session_id/forward"}, refresh: {:post, "/session/:session_id/refresh"}, get_title: {:get, "/session/:session_id/title"}, get_window_handle: {:get, "/session/:session_id/window"}, close_window: {:delete, "/session/:session_id/window"}, switch_to_window: {:post, "/session/:session_id/window"}, get_window_handles: {:get, "/session/:session_id/window/handles"}, new_window: {:post, "/session/:session_id/window/new"}, switch_to_frame: {:post, "/session/:session_id/frame"}, switch_to_parent_frame: {:post, "/session/:session_id/frame/parent"}, get_window_rect: {:get, "/session/:session_id/window/rect"}, set_window_rect: {:post, "/session/:session_id/window/rect"}, maximize_window: {:post, "/session/:session_id/window/maximize"}, minimize_window: {:post, "/session/:session_id/window/minimize"}, fullscreen_window: {:post, "/session/:session_id/window/fullscreen"}, get_active_element: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/active"}, find_element: {:post, "/session/:session_id/element"}, find_elements: {:post, "/session/:session_id/elements"}, find_element_from_element: {:post, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/element"}, find_elements_from_element: {:post, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/elements"}, is_element_selected: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/selected"}, get_element_attribute: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/attribute/:name"}, get_element_property: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/property/:name"}, get_element_css_value: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/css/:property_name"}, get_element_text: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/text"}, get_element_tag_name: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/name"}, get_element_rect: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/rect"}, is_element_enabled: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/enabled"}, is_element_displayed: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/displayed"}, element_click: {:post, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/click"}, element_clear: {:post, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/clear"}, element_send_keys: {:post, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/value"}, get_page_source: {:get, "/session/:session_id/source"}, execute_script: {:post, "/session/:session_id/execute/sync"}, execute_async_script: {:post, "/session/:session_id/execute/async"}, get_all_cookies: {:get, "/session/:session_id/cookie"}, get_named_cookie: {:get, "/session/:session_id/cookie/:name"}, add_cookie: {:post, "/session/:session_id/cookie"}, delete_cookie: {:delete, "/session/:session_id/cookie/:name"}, delete_all_cookies: {:delete, "/session/:session_id/cookie"}, perform_actions: {:post, "/session/:session_id/actions"}, release_actions: {:delete, "/session/:session_id/actions"}, dismiss_alert: {:post, "/session/:session_id/alert/dismiss"}, accept_alert: {:post, "/session/:session_id/alert/accept"}, get_alert_text: {:get, "/session/:session_id/alert/text"}, send_alert_text: {:post, "/session/:session_id/alert/text"}, take_screenshot: {:get, "/session/:session_id/screenshot"}, take_element_screenshot: {:get, "/session/:session_id/element/:element_id/screenshot"}}

def.name: execute_async_script
execute_script

types.name: Driver
types.doc:
The `Selenium::Driver` is the root class for interacting with browsers

### Using with `Selenium::Service`

If you passed in a `Selenium::Service` you *MUST* call `Selenium::Driver#stop` when you are done to stop the service
or else the process it starts will continue running on your computer after the program ends
types.summary: The Selenium::Driver is the root class for interacting with browsers

def.name: for
def.body:
case browser
when :chrome
  Chrome::Driver.new(**opts)
when :firefox, :gecko
  Firefox::Driver.new(**opts)
when :remote
  Remote::Driver.new(**opts)
when :safari
  Safari::Driver.new(**opts)
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("unknown driver: #{browser}"))
end

def.name: create_session
def.body:
begin
  parameters = {capabilities: {alwaysMatch: capabilities}}
  data = command_handler.execute(:new_session, parameters: parameters)
  Session.new(http_client, command_handler, (data.dig("value", "sessionId")).as_s)
rescue ex : Error
  if retry
    create_session(capabilities, retry: false)
  else
    raise(ex)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: attribute
instance_methods.doc:
`attribute` is for referencing static fields
if you are trying to access fields that change you should use `property`
instance_methods.summary: #attribute is for referencing static fields if you are trying to access fields that change you should use #property

def.name: find_child_element
def.body:
parameters = {using: using, value: value}
data = command_handler.execute(:find_element_from_element, path_variables, parameters)
entry = data["value"].as_h
Element.new(command_handler, session_id, entry.first_value.as_s)

def.name: find_child_elements
def.body:
parameters = {using: using, value: value}
data = command_handler.execute(:find_elements_from_element, path_variables, parameters)
data["value"].as_a.map do |entry|
  entry.as_h.first_value.as_s
end.map do |element_id|
  Element.new(command_handler, session_id, element_id)
end

types.name: ElementRect
types.doc:
TODO: I don't remember why I made the properties floats nor why they are nilable.
If they were Int64, this could be combined with `Selenium::WindowRect`
types.summary: TODO I don't remember why I made the properties floats nor why they are nilable.

def.name: midpoint
def.body:
temp_x = x
temp_y = y
temp_width = width
temp_height = height
if temp_x.nil?
  return
end
if temp_y.nil?
  return
end
if temp_width.nil?
  return
end
if temp_height.nil?
  return
end
Selenium::Coordinate.new(x: (temp_x + (temp_width / 2)).to_i, y: (temp_y + (temp_height / 2)).to_i)

def.name: from_element
def.body:
tag_name = element.tag_name
if tag_name == "select"
else
  raise(InvalidTagError.new(expected: "select", got: tag_name))
end
new(element)

def.name: deselect_all
def.body:
if multiple?
else
  raise(UnsupportedOperationError.new("you may only deselect multiple options in a multi-select"))
end
options.each do |option|
  deselect_option(option)
end

def.name: select_all
def.body:
if multiple?
else
  raise(UnsupportedOperationError.new("you may only select multiple options in a multi-select"))
end
options.each do |option|
  select_option(option)
end

def.name: delete
def.body:
response = HTTP::Client.delete(base_url + path)
parsed_response = JSON.parse(response.body)
if has_error?(parsed_response)
  raise(Error.from_json(parsed_response["value"].to_json))
end
parsed_response

def.name: get
def.body:
response = HTTP::Client.get(base_url + path)
parsed_response = JSON.parse(response.body)
if has_error?(parsed_response)
  raise(Error.from_json(parsed_response["value"].to_json))
end
parsed_response

def.name: post
def.body:
url = base_url + path
response = HTTP::Client.post(url, body: body)
parsed_response = JSON.parse(response.body)
if has_error?(parsed_response)
  raise(Error.from_json(parsed_response["value"].to_json))
end
parsed_response

def.name: from_symbol
def.body:
case symbol
when :css
  CSS
when :link_text
  LINK_TEXT
when :partial_link_text
  PARTIAL_LINK_TEXT
when :tag_name
  TAG_NAME
when :xpath
  XPATH
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new)
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (driver_path : String, port : Int32 = default_port, args = [] of String)

def.name: stop
def.body:
begin
  send_shutdown_command
  process.try(&.wait)
ensure
  stop_process(process)
end

def.name: active_element
def.body:
data = command_handler.execute(:get_active_element, path_variables)
entry = data["value"].as_h
Element.new(command_handler, id, entry.first_value.as_s)

def.name: find_element
def.body:
data = command_handler.execute(:find_element, path_variables, {using: using, value: value})
entry = data["value"].as_h
Element.new(command_handler, id, entry.first_value.as_s)

def.name: find_elements
def.body:
data = command_handler.execute(:find_elements, path_variables, {using: using, value: value})
element_ids = data["value"].as_a.map do |entry|
  entry.as_h.first_value.as_s
end
element_ids.map do |element_id|
  Element.new(command_handler, id, element_id)
end

def.name: move_to
def.body:
sequence = Selenium::InputSourceActionSequence.new(type: "pointer", id: "action-sequence-key", actions: [Selenium::Action.new("pointerMove", x: x, y: y)])
perform_actions([sequence])

def.name: move_to
def.body:
midpoint = element.rect.try(&.midpoint)
if midpoint.nil?
  return
end
move_to(x: midpoint.x, y: midpoint.y)

def.name: new_window

instance_methods.name: set_window_rect
instance_methods.args_string: (width : Int64? = nil, height : Int64? = nil, x : Int64? = nil, y : Int64? = nil) : WindowRect

def.name: set_window_rect
def.body:
window_rect = WindowRect.new(width: width, height: height, x: x, y: y)
set_window_rect(window_rect)

def.name: set_window_rect
def.body:
parameters = window_rect
data = command_handler.execute(:set_window_rect, path_variables, parameters)
WindowRect.from_json(data["value"].to_json)

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (x = nil, y = nil, width = nil, height = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(x, y, width, height)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_
